Legal_Issue: Did the Citizenship Judge breach procedural fairness by failing to specify a deadline for additional documentation?
Application_Facts: Applicants were given 20 days to provide documents but failed to do so within 60 days as per procedural rules.
Court_Ruling: No breach of procedural fairness found
Procedural_Issue: Failure to submit documents within required timeframe
Evidence_Used: Available evidence before the Citizenship Judge
Application_Basis: Proof of residency under Canadian citizenship law
Evidence_Assessed: Documentation submitted (or not submitted) by applicants
Governing_Rule: Applicants must prove residency under section 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act using the balance of probabilities.
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to provide required documentation within 60 days
Cause_Description: Applicants' citizenship applications rejected due to insufficient proof of residency.
Evidence_Handling: Judge's decision based on available evidence; met natural justice standards
Evidence_Issues: Incomplete or untimely submission of residency documentation
Evidence_Assessment: Evaluated based on balance of probabilities standard
Decision_Rationale: No procedural unfairness; decision supported by evidence
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to meet documentary submission deadlines
